snippet: Gov. Chris Christie demanded that existing contracts and their renewals be exempt from the audits approved by the New Jersey Legislature.
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie says he aims to weaken significantly a measure approved by the legislature to increase oversight of New Jersey's privately held halfway houses, which handle thousands of inmates each year; says he will sign the law only if all existing contracts are exempt from reviews from the state auditor; it is the second time that Christie has moved to weaken new regulations for halfway houses.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie demanded that existing contracts and their renewals be exempt from the audits approved by the New Jersey Legislature.

headline.seo: Christie Seeks to Weaken New Oversight of Halfway Houses
headline.main: Christie Seeks to Weaken Oversight of Halfway Houses
headline.print_headline: Christie Seeks to Weaken Halfway Houses’ Oversight
